name: St. Ananias of Damascus
summary: Ananias of Damascus was a disciple of Jesus who lived in Damascus. He was instructed by the Lord in a vision to go to Saul (later Paul) and restore his sight after his conversion on the road to Damascus. Despite his initial fear, Ananias obeyed and baptized Paul, playing a crucial role in the conversion of the Apostle to the Gentiles. According to tradition, he later became bishop of Damascus and was martyred.
